result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly A Eckert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court advises the defendant she cannot possess firearms, and cannot vote until her civil rights are restored.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess alcohol or illegally controlled substances.
AODA, treatment or program.  Random screening.

Provide DNA sample if not previously provided, pay DNA surcharge.
Fine of $900.00 including costs, assessments and surcharges.  to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 7/17/14 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kelly A Eckert in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant she cannot possess firearms, she must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until her civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction with Huber and 1 day credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  18 months.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay a fine of $900 including costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $50 per month commencing 7-17-14 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess alcohol or illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) maintain employment; 7) parenting classes. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant Kelly A Eckert in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.    There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kelly A Eckert in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel attempting to obtain deferred prosecution agreement and requests additional time.  Court orders case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 44.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kelly A Eckert in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kelly A Eckert in court with attorney John Forrestal for Mark Pecora.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense received discovery and an offer and needs to review with the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kelly A Eckert in court with attorney Christopher Hartley for Mark Pecora.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-21-2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kelly A Eckert

Defendant Kelly A Eckert in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-12-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
